content: Recently launched: https://rscj.org/
It merged together a number of sub-sites and uses separate colors/branding/menu/footer depending on the section/layout being viewed -- see the header with the sections/options on the left side.
Looks good @Laryn :+1: ...I've noticed some glitches with the menus, but I'm sure you're aware.
Try me. :wink:
menu-jumping-on-mobile.gif
^^ this for example :smile:
...the hover colors on the menu items are not distinct enough either.
image.png
Ah, yes, they added the second dropdown for the donate links on that sub-section themselves... ugh. I did know about that. :sweat_smile:
@Laryn your work is so good! Do you do the design yourself?
@jenlampton I have in the past but lately I'm mostly doing development, structure, and minor design tweaks. I've got another team member who leads the design typically.
(thanks!)

New Backdrop website for a Swiss catholic community (located at the village I grew up)
https://pfarrei-villmergen.ch/
https://pfarrei-villmergen.ch/kirchenmusik (uses events and related content a lot)
I spent quite some time optimizing typography and readability, maybe I still should work on contrasts a bit...

Thanks to config management, I am pretty fast now with sites like these. It's such a great feature in Backdrop, thanks to everyone who was involved...
Very clean and nice. Great work. On mobile there is a menu in the footer that doesn't seem to work.
Oh, thank you @docwilmot , regarding menu bug, I forgot to uncheck a certain box... fixed:-) Screenshot-2020-08-31-at-13.51.41.png
But now it's just got a header "Events" with no items beneath that.
Nice site, indeed! One nitpick: If a search has no results, shouldn't there be some "no result text"? https://pfarrei-villmergen.ch/suche?combine=abc
@mazze.ch ++
mazze.ch :-) (Karma: 6)
Nice! Out of curiosity, about how much custom code is there, verses what was done with existing core/contrib modules and themes?

@oadaeh (Jason Flatt) technically rather simple, just two content types, no custom modules. But I use my own CSS framework (getuikit.com) and did quite some work directly in the template files.

UIkit
UIkit, a lightweight and modular front-end framework for developing fast and powerful web interfaces.

https://schwimmbad4you.ch > A small company specialised in planning and building swimming pools. Rather simple tech-wise, but we have a long way to go for getting SEO visibility.

Stefan Furrer | Schwimmbad- und Wassertechnik
Stefan Furrer | Schwimmbad- und Wassertechnik | 5630 Muri | 056 670 98 70
Cool! Tiny "bugreport": the footer-background.jpg image is a 404.
Oops, "Angebot" in the top menu gives a not found error as well.
Opps, fixed. It was not my intention to force you to be beta testers;-)
@mazze.ch I think people here enjoy being beta testers. A bit of I scratch your back, you scratch mine
@mazze.ch what solution did you use for the mega-menu implementation?

Looks really good...

When hovering over the menu items the colour change is only very minimal. Consider making the hover colour darker or dark blue would look good :smile:

Hope this helps.
.
image.png
@klonos custom template, based on the UIKit framework (not Bootstrap). A legacy from D7 projects.
The front page video took 1.7 minutes to load on my work PC. Our network is rubbish though. Speed test says 4Mbps download 12Mbps upload.
It seems, that we're not simply happy to be beta-testers, it's more like "everyone's a critic". :rofl:

docwilmot said:

The front page video took 1.7 minutes to load on my work PC. Our network is rubbish though. Speed test says 4Mbps download 12Mbps upload.

It loaded straight away for me... but we do have 350Mbps download :smile:

Also, if you are getting more up speed than down speed, you have a problem with your wiring... for ADSL you should always have a faster download speed.
I think most networks are faster down than up. If not, they are the same. I don't recall ever seeing it the other way.
Yep, hence the "rubbish" description. Its a healthcare facility though. I have no input in this.

https://llv.ch for a Teacher's Assoctiation in the canton of Lucerne, Switzerland. It's such a pleasure to build websites like these in Backdrop CMS, focusing on clean design and good editor experience. The customer has no idea what the CMS is, but he really likes the GUI (old site was D7)
So yeah, the site I was working before I left the library apparently went live. They didn't tell me but the Backdrop site lives. https://jaxpubliclibrary.org/

Soft launching tonight: https://williams-syndrome.org
Screenshot_2020-10-04-Williams-Syndrome-Association.jpg
Nice! Good job :smiling_face:

My latest Backdrop site is live (with a few kinks to be worked out in the back end). This is a large site with over a thousand pages, many thousands of files, e-commerce, donations, etc. etc.
https://www.mhsmi.org/
image.png
Does anyone want to give a 5-10 minute case study during the Backdrop CMS virtual mini-camp?
This would be Oct 15th about 12:00pm (Pacific time - USA)
The exact time is flexible/negotiable.

What exactly this would include is not clear. My idea is that it would be a very quick tour of the site with some discussion about why you choose Backdrop and how you dealt with any interesting problems.

My latest Backdrop site is live ...

That is really nice. Well done

docwilmot said:

My latest Backdrop site is live ...

That is really nice. Well done

Thank you! It was a big deal. The pandemic made for an 8 month delay that caused some challenges with data migration and needing to redesign the site to accommodate new needs. That went very well technically.
I looked into a browser for the link dialog. Seems doable. Will do a rough contrib module this weekend. (You have interesting feature requests it seems, to me at least). :smile:

docwilmot said:

I looked into a browser for the link dialog. Seems doable. Will do a rough contrib module this weekend. (You have interesting feature requests it seems, to me at least). :smile:

Thanks! Part of that is for having lots of real life use cases from 20 years of being in business. I was going to tackle this next week. What I wanted to do is mirror the Ckeditor file browser setup (in configuration) from Drupal 7 - we already have IMCE installed and i think the code is there in the D7 module to hook it in from there. It seemed the easiest way to tackle it and will be flexible. I.e default NONE, but IMCE is in list if installed. AKA: (i.e. the code could be stolen (hopefully) from drupal 7 ckeditor project and then ported to Backdrop ?)
ckeditor-file-browser-settings.jpeg

Nice job @Elisabeth Garbeil :+1: ...a couple of comments if I may:

  • the main navigation menu needs hover-over effects for its menu items.
  • the slideshow is a few pixels off to the left on super-wide screens
screencapture-mhsmi-org-2020-10-10-00_01_23.png

klonos said:

Nice job Elisabeth Garbeil :+1: ...a couple of comments if I may:

  • the main navigation menu needs hover-over effects for its menu items.
  • the slideshow is a few pixels off to the left on super-wide screens

Thank you.
1) hover coming. She didn't really want anything, but we will do a slight size increase in the next few weeks.
2) PC or mac - on my computer it goes all the way across (on a 4k screen). and what browser? Not a worry for us - most of the users are mobile. But I'm curious. There's no margin on left at all for me on slideshow. Right margin doesn't show up until 3200+ pixels and that's there for scrollbars on mobile. image.png
I'm on a MackBook Pro (15.3") + another 2 monitors ...one of the external monitors is a 35" ultrawide curved at 2560 x 1080 and that's where I noticed the issue.
...I guess it's not a matter of pixels, rather than ratio, which in my case is 21:9

klonos said:

I'm on a MackBook Pro (15.3") + another 2 monitors ...one of the external monitors is a 35" ultrawide curved at 2560 x 1080 and that's where I noticed the issue.

Interesting. It does sound like the ultrawide curving may be throwing things off. Mine is a 4k 35" or 37" but it's flat screen. I don't typically use my laptop monitor unless I'm on the road. My computer is docked most of the time. The laptop is a Retina 15 inch too, but I don't develop on it. Too small. That monitor sounds like it would be great for gaming or video editing.
The curving shouldn't matter, but yeah it definitely is because of the ultrawide thing.
